channel.title: Zamorak sword concept [show off]
channel.description:
well, i figured ss needed a counter part... this is 100% free hand, then mirrored, this also happens to be my second work. *credit to who ever made the 317 male model, helped me even though i just used it at the end to see the size of weapon.*
relevant size, kinda lazy to make it a lil bit smaller [img]http://img130.imageshack.us/img130/7868/zamorakswordconcept.png[/img]
just the sword [img]http://img194.imageshack.us/img194/4992/zamorakswordconcept2.png[/img]
wire frame [img]http://img697.imageshack.us/img697/4667/zamorakswordconcept3.png[/img]
once again, this is only my second model... tips would be more helpful than flames, no joke.

item.title: Zamorak sword concept [show off]
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“hilfmir, post:3, topic:317098”]free hand as in i placed and connected the dots with no reference then lift it into 3d with move tool.
the handle was a primitive, i was going to work colors in but got lazy.
and as for over use of poly, hell idk what im doing, just figured that lines pulls the others when i move it with tool…[/quote]
Trace method is the ‘connect the dots’ method. it refers to modelling with the create tool. whys it called trace method? cuz most ppl who use it trace an image and its like your drawing the model.

Read full topic

item.title: Zamorak sword concept [show off]
item.dc:creator: @hilfmir hilfmir
item.description:
@hilfmir wrote:

free hand as in i placed and connected the dots with no reference then lift it into 3d with move tool.
the handle was a primitive, i was going to work colors in but got lazy.
and as for over use of poly, hell idk what im doing, just figured that lines pulls the others when i move it with tool…

Read full topic

item.title: Zamorak sword concept [show off]
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

‘free hand’ means trace method btw. the poly is excessive, you dont need that many faces, you could have had almost the same result with 1/2 the amount of faces… ESPECIALLY for the handle… why so much useless poly? it doesnt make it better =/ the coloring is far from decent… the blades grey edge should be even.

on a positive note: the design isnt too bad. with more work and experience it could turn out decent. ill overlook the random jagged faces aswell as other qualities sincee its only your 2nd model.

Read full topic
